body:
Comment 3 by **jwfearn**: 
I suggest the following:
1) If no environment variable is present, use a default value.  Something like:
~/.go/gopath/
2) [OPTIONAL] In the installer, present a SKIPPABLE option to allow users who care to
specify a custom GOPATH
3) [OPTIONAL] Store options like GOPATH in a configuration file.  Something like:
~/.go/goconfig.json

I just made up the above names.  I don't know your system.  I'm sure other names would
make more sense.

The above steps would:
a) make it possible for new users (like me) to get started more easily
b) provide customization for advanced users
c) make the system functional without environment variables

FYI: GOPATH seems to be a big problem for prospective new users.  See the large number
of results for this search:
http://stackoverflow.com/search?q=GOPATH
